SEARCH
Module graphicInterface
Package graph

Class EdgeWeightedGraph

java.lang.Object
graph.EdgeWeightedGraph
Direct Known Subclasses:
Board
public class EdgeWeightedGraph extends Object
EdgeWeightedGraph represents the board of the game. It is an edge weighted graph because we need to save the barriers, so we will change the weight of edges with a barrier.

  • Constructor Details

    • EdgeWeightedGraph

      public EdgeWeightedGraph(int size) throws BadSizeException
      Constructor method for the EdgeWeightedGraph class. It creates an array of LinkedList of length depending on the size value.
      Parameters:
      size - number of rows/columns.
      Throws:
      BadSizeException - if the size isn't strictly greater than 0, it throws an error.

  • Method Details

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Getter method for the size.
      Returns:
      the size of the EdgeWeightedGraph.

    • getAdjacencyList

      public LinkedList<Edge>[] getAdjacencyList()
      Getter method for the adjacency list.
      Returns:
      the adjacencyList of the EdgeWeightedGraph.

    • addEdge

      public void addEdge(Edge edge)
      Method adding an edge to the adjacency list. It takes and edge, and add it to the corresponding source in the adjacency list.
      Parameters:
      edge - the edge added to the adjacency list.

    • initializeGraph

      public void initializeGraph()
      Method initializing the graph depending on its size. It creates a graph where every node is connected to nodes on its right, left, top and bottom.

    • DFS

      public boolean DFS(Position pos, Color color)
      Intermediate method for the DFS. It creates an array to mark visited Positions.
      Parameters:
      pos - Position of the current player.
      color - Color of the current player.
      Returns:
      true if the player has a path, false if not.

    • checkPath

      public Map<Player,Boolean> checkPath(List<Player> players)
      This method checks if every player has a path to the side he needs to go to. To do that, we do a Depth First Search starting from the Position of every player.
      Parameters:
      players - the list of players.
      Returns:
      a map with every player and a boolean which is true if the corresponding player has a path.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • displayGraph

      public void displayGraph()
      Method displaying the graph. The display is really simple and is just useful for tests.
